text: Anwar Raslan () (born 3 February 1963) is a former Syrian colonel. He led a unit of Syria's . In January 2022, he was convicted of crimes against humanity in a German court with. The specific charges against him were 4,000 counts of torture, 58 counts of murder, and rape and sexual coercion. His case was the first international war crimes case against a member of the Syrian government during the presidency of Bashar al-Assad. ==References== Category:Living people Category:1963 births Category:Syrian military people Category:People convicted of murder Category:War criminals
